intro: Lytogomphus stilbifer, commonly known as the black-tailed skimmer, is a species of dragonfly belonging to the family Libellulidae. It is characterized by its slender body and elongated wings, which are typically transparent with a dark brown or black abdomen. This dragonfly is often found near freshwater habitats such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The males are distinguishable by their dark, often black-tipped tails, while females have more variable coloration. Lytogomphus stilbifer plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems as both predator and prey.
